snippet.title: Amber Hear says her 'taste in women is better than her taste in men'
snippet.description:
Amber Hear says her 'taste in women is better than her taste in men':
https://metro.co.uk/2018/11/02/amber-heards-taste-in-women-is-better-than-her-taste-in-men-but-shes-never-been-drawn-to-healthy-people-8098115/.

Thanks for watching, subscribe for more videos:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3bDaRhDkuRGhBzgEsMvFQg?sub_confirmation=1
  Amber Heard just publicly shaded Johnny Depp again.  The actress claimed she’s better at picking female lovers than males, lamenting that her taste isn’t exactly ‘healthy’ individuals.  Speaking to Marie Claire UK, Amber discussed her same-sex romances saying she still had ‘hope’ for a stable relationship.  Asked whether her ‘taste in women’ was better than her taste in men, Amber replied: ‘Hell, yeah. Hell, yeah. Hell, yeah.’  The actress continued: ‘I’m not necessarily drawn to… “healthy”. But I have hope. I hope to find an honest attraction to someone who is healthy. I very much want that.’  Amber famously filed for divorce from Pirates Of The Caribbean actor Johnny in May 2016 amid claims of domestic violence, which he strenuously denies.  Advertisement  Advertisement  The actors were married for 15 months but Amber reportedly also considered herself married to ex-girlfriend Tasya van Ree when they dated for four years in 2008.  Amber continued to the magazine: ‘[My relationships] are a running joke among my small group of friends.  ‘They call me Calamity. With Tasya, they’d say,”That was weird, but it’s not going to get weirder,” and then…’  The actress, who has also dated Elon Musk, Sean Penn and Sean Faris, seemed to be referencing her marriage to Johnny, which did indeed ‘get weirder’ when they settled a dispute over claims he hit her with an iPhone.  In a recent interview GQ, Johnny said the allegations ‘hurt’ as he denied them once again.  Johnny said: [It’s] the last thing I would’ve done. I might look stupid, but I ain’t f******g stupid.’  He added: ‘It hurts. The thing that hurt me is being presented as something that you’re really as far away from as you could possibly get, you know?  ‘But to… To harm someone you love? As a kind of bully? No, it didn’t, it couldn’t even sound like me.’  Amber later got her legal team involved, saying the interview – which ‘blatantly disregarded’ their confidentiality agreement – was an example of the actor’s ‘continued psychological abuse’.  Advertisement  Advertisement      Got a story?    If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.   Advertisement  Advertisement  
#AmberHear, #says, #taste, #women, #better, #than, #taste
#AmberHeardJohnnyDepp, #AmberHeardbisexual, #AmberHeardhusband, #AmberHeardex, #AmberHeardlesbian, #AmberHeardgirlfriend, #AmberHearddomesticviolence, #JohnnyDeppexwife
